DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor Toxic Substance Causing Chronic Disease or Disorder Exposure Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether the donor has a history of exposure to toxic substances that may have led to chronic conditions as provided by the primary history source.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor Toxic Substance Causing Chronic Disease or Disorder Exposure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Having to do with poison or something harmful to the body. Toxic substances usually cause unwanted side effects._Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical._Existing in such a way that some specific thing happens as a result._Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: Toxic Substance Causing Chronic Disease or Disorder Exposure
Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with poison or something harmful to the body. Toxic substances usually cause unwanted side effects. :Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.:Existing in such a way that some specific thing happens as a result.:Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with poison or something harmful to the body. Toxic substances usually cause unwanted side effects.
Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
Existing in such a way that some specific thing happens as a result.
Usually used to describe a condition that is persistent and long standing.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of subjecting someone or something to an influencing experience.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Exposure to toxic substances
ReferenceDocuments.description: Exposure to toxic substances that may have led to chronic conditions
